name: Pluralith
headline: Automated infrastructure compliance and documentation
description:
Pluralith automates compliance by documenting cloud infrastructure directly from the codebase. Companies like Jefferson Health pay us to automate their infrastructure compliance and save 5h a week per infrastructure engineer.

More simply put: We generate infrastructure diagrams directly from Terraform state.

founders.name: Daniel Putzer, Founder
founders.description: Self-taught developer from Vienna. Avid fan of the Dune series.

## Directly from your Codebase.Completely Automated.

## Save your team hours on documentation
Set up once in 3 easy steps and never spend a minute on drawing infra diagrams again.
![Pluralith visualises your Terraform architecture in 3 easy steps](https://d33wubrfki0l68.cloudfront.net/5e775492038f3c3a059b8af954b86e16e27d0afa/a60b7/_nuxt/steps.1aaa4419.svg)![Pluralith visualises your Terraform architecture in 3 easy steps](https://d33wubrfki0l68.cloudfront.net/ddc70d72c8744e3a5961ddf5a44bc714fff26637/ad6db/_nuxt/steps-mobile.6b7688e8.svg)
###### 1
### Set up Terraform
Set up Terraform in a GitOps flow. Pluralith runs terraform plan under the hood to get data to visualise.
###### 2
### Run Pluralith
Add Pluralith to your pipeline. On every pull request the Pluralith CLI runs and generates a diagram.
###### 3
### Enjoy the show
Pluralith posts the Diagram as a pull request comment. The Pluralith Dashboard gives you a visual history of all your Terraform plans.
## Surface issues before they become issues
Pluralith aggregates all kinds of data about your infrastructure into one clear visual.
## Change Highlighting
See all plan changes visualised in a proper diagram. No more checking 5 miles of terminal output before applying.
![Pluralith shows you changes, drift, costs and compliance information for Terraform](https://d33wubrfki0l68.cloudfront.net/fdf305191c07b642f630c1ba1670c52a384c189e/f4bdd/_nuxt/features.297a9376.svg)[Get Started](https://www.pluralith.com/</>)
## Drift Detection
Catch drift as soon as possible. Pluralith highlights which resources have drifted and makes sure you don’t miss anything.
## Cost Data
Add financial context to your docs. Pluralith runs Infracost under the hood and blends its output into the diagram.
###### Coming Soon
## Compliance Data
Is your infrastructure compliant? Pluralith runs Regula under the hood and shows you which resources need attention.
## Runs wherever you run Terraform
Pluralith helps you out in every stage of your Terraform journey.

generated_description:
**Company Overview: Pluralith**

Founded in 2022 and hailing from Vienna, Austria, Pluralith is a Y Combinator startup (Batch S22) making waves in the world of infrastructure automation. With a compact team of just two, Pluralith addresses a critical pain point for companies managing cloud infrastructure: compliance documentation.

**Mission & Product**

The aim is simple yet profound: automate infrastructure compliance and documentation. Pluralith directly generates infrastructure diagrams from your Terraform state, allowing companies like Jefferson Health to save an impressive five hours each week per engineer. In essence, they turn code into clear, visual documentation automatically.

**What They Do**

Here's the scoop: instead of manually drafting diagrams or poring over dizzyingly long terminal outputs, Pluralith’s platform allows teams to visualize their Terraform projects directly from the codebase. 

Set up is straightforward:
1. **Set Up Terraform**: Create a GitOps flow using Terraform.
2. **Run Pluralith**: Integrate it into your pipeline, prompting automatic diagram generation with every pull request.
3. **Enjoy**: Diagrams pop up as comments in pull requests, with a dashboard providing a visual history of all Terraform plans.

Their features include:
- Change highlighting and drift detection to spot issues early.
- Financial insights by integrating cost data from Infracost.
- Upcoming compliance checks with Regula to ensure infrastructure adheres to necessary standards.

**Business Model**

Pluralith operates on a straightforward pricing model with flexibility for users. They offer a flat-rate package and a pay-as-you-go feature for additional plan runs beyond the base amount.

**Get Involved**

For developers interested in streamlining their infrastructure documentation and compliance, Pluralith provides a free forever option for local development and a simple setup for CI environments.

**Conclusion**

In a nutshell, Pluralith is redefining the way teams handle infrastructure documentation by turning what used to be a tedious task into a delightful and automatic experience. If you're struggling with manual compliance and documentation in your cloud operations, it might be time to check them out at [pluralith.com](https://www.pluralith.com).
